title: Festivals and Employment Opportunities (10/03/25)
description: Please arrive 5 minutes prior to the event scheduled start time, as event attendance will be taken and also to ensure you do not miss any information.

If you have any issues, such as finding the room, you can always stop by our office - Graduate+ in Curzon, Ground Floor- opposite the barriers and we will be more than happy to help you with any queries you might have. Use the link provided to join the session.
*This session will be filmed for promotional purposes, if you do not wish to appear in any footage, please notify a member of staff at the event.

title: Meet the Enterprise Team (11.03.2025)
description: BCU’s Student Enterprise team have an exciting offer which is one of the reasons that BCU students lead the way in the West Midlands for business startups. In the academic year 2022-3, nearly 100 start-ups were founded by BCU students and graduates – more than any other university in the West Midlands. The figures see BCU rank 14th nationally. This session will introduce you to different aspects of that offer and the staff who work in this team, who are primed to help you take your business idea to market!

title: Go Big or Go Home! (11/03/25)
description: A session aimed at promoting the MSc Quantity Surveying conversion course to BCU final years. Graduates from any discipline can undertake the MSc Quantity Surveying as a conversion Master’s course en route to becoming a MRICS chartered Quantity Surveyor. The course will also equip graduates and professionals in architecture, engineering and construction with the skills to become industry leaders in the management of project costs.

title: Problem Solving and Solution Focused Thinking (12/03/25)
description: Understand how to apply the latest thinking models to solve problems big and small!
Why a change of hat might change how you view a problem.
Transform your brainstorming - create hundreds of solutions and find the solution right for you.
It's not what you know - work your connections and get the most out of your network.
Use a simple four-step model to achieve your goals and change how you view problems.
Why asking yourself some high-quality questions makes the difference between success and failure.

title: Defeat Procrastination (12/03/25)
description: Understand the science behind procrastination and effective methods to get in to 'do and win' mode.
Meet the self gratification monkey who stops you from getting things done.
Understand why the panic monster kick-starts action.
Use simple prioritisation techniques to plan action.
Know how to get in to 'do and win' mode quickly and effectively.
Learn how to become more efficient in your work.
